sentences: Mike Marciano is a two-time Grammy Award-winning audio engineer, multi-platinum and gold record award recipient, and GMA recipient who started his career in 1980, working exclusively at Systems Two Recording Studio in Brooklyn, New York.
section: N/A

sentences: Early in his career, he worked with many well-known rock and heavy metal groups, including Type O Negative, Carnivore, Agnostic Front, Life of Agony.
section: N/A

sentences: Many of his hardcore and metal credits are noted in Encyclopaedia Metallum.
section: N/A

sentences: His work with Type O Negative was used in multiple movie soundtracks and other media.
section: N/A

sentences: Since the early 90s, he has worked with some of the top musicians in the jazz field, including jazz greats like Wynton Marsalis (and his Grammy-nominated “Joe Cool’s Blues”), Clark Terry, Elvin Jones, and Steve Coleman.
section: N/A

sentences: His work with Don Braden was used as the theme song for Cosby.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2011, he received his first Grammy Award for Best Jazz Vocal Album "The Mosaic Project" by Terri Lynne Carrington.
section: N/A

sentences: Then, in 2013 he received his second Grammy Award for Best Jazz Instrumental Album, Money Jungle: Provocative in Blue, by Terri Lynne Carrington.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2021, Mike received his Grammy Win certificate for his mastering work on "Puertos: Music from International Waters: by The Emilio Solla Tango Jazz Orchestra, Best Jazz Album Also in 2021, Mike received a Juno award for Andy Milne and Unison's Best Jazz Album Award for reMission.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2020, his work on "Carib" by David Sanchez was nominated for a Grammy Award in the Best Latin Jazz album category.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2019, his work on Elio Villafranca's "Cinque" was nominated for a Best Latin Jazz Album Grammy Award.
section: N/A

sentences: Also In 2019, Mike's work on "Happened, Happening" by Yuying Hsu  won him a Golden Melody Award for Best Instrumental Recording Album - Technical Category.
section: N/A

sentences: Miguel Zenón  and "Art of the Arrangement" by Doug Beavers).
section: N/A

sentences: Marciano recorded In for a Penny, In for a Pound by Henry Threadgill, which received a Pulitzer Prize for Music in 2016.
